info.title: TON HTTP API C++
info.description:
This API enables HTTP access to TON blockchain - getting accounts and wallets information, looking up blocks and transactions, sending messages to the blockchain, calling get methods of smart contracts, and more.

In addition to REST API, all methods are available through [JSON-RPC endpoint](#json%20rpc)  with `method` equal to method name and `params` passed as a dictionary.

The response contains a JSON object, which always has a boolean field `ok` and either `error` or `result`. If `ok` equals true, the request was successful and the result of the query can be found in the `result` field. In case of an unsuccessful request, `ok` equals false and the error is explained in the `error`.

API Key should be sent either as `api_key` query parameter or `X-API-Key` header

post.description: All API methods are available through this single endpoint using JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol. Send the method name in the `method` field and parameters as a dictionary in `params`. Useful when you need to call multiple methods in sequence or prefer JSON-RPC over REST.

get.description: Validates an address and returns it in all standard formats. Use this to convert between address formats or to validate user input. Returns raw format (0:abc), base64 bounceable (EQ), base64 non-bounceable (UQ), and URL-safe variants.

post.description: Validates an address and returns it in all standard formats. Use this to convert between address formats or to validate user input. Returns raw format (0:abc...), base64 bounceable (EQ...), base64 non-bounceable (UQ...), and URL-safe variants.

get.description: Validates a hash and returns it in all standard formats. Use this to convert between hex (64 chars) and base64 (44 chars) representations. Works with any 256-bit hash including transaction hashes, block hashes, and message hashes.

post.description: Validates a hash and returns it in all standard formats. Use this to convert between hex (64 chars) and base64 (44 chars) representations. Works with any 256-bit hash including transaction hashes, block hashes, and message hashes.

get.description: Converts a raw address to user-friendly base64 format. Raw addresses use the format `workchain:hex` (e.g., `0:abc...`). The packed format is shorter and includes a checksum for error detection.

post.description: Converts a raw address to user-friendly base64 format. Raw addresses use the format `workchain:hex` (e.g., `0:abc...`). The packed format is shorter and includes a checksum for error detection.

get.description: Converts a user-friendly base64 address back to its raw components. Returns the workchain ID, account hex, and flags indicating if the address is bounceable or testnet-only.

post.description: Converts a user-friendly base64 address back to its raw components. Returns the workchain ID, account hex, and flags indicating if the address is bounceable or testnet-only.

get.description: Returns the current state of any account on the TON blockchain. Includes the balance (in nanotons), smart contract code and data (if deployed), account status, and a reference to the last transaction. This is the primary endpoint for checking if an address exists and what's deployed there.

post.description: Returns the current state of any account on the TON blockchain. Includes the balance (in nanotons), smart contract code and data (if deployed), account status, and a reference to the last transaction. This is the primary endpoint for checking if an address exists and what's deployed there.

get.description: Returns detailed account information with parsed contract state. For wallet contracts, identifies the wallet version (v3, v4, v5) and extracts wallet-specific fields like seqno and public key. For other contracts, returns the raw state.

post.description: Returns detailed account information with parsed contract state. For wallet contracts, identifies the wallet version (v3, v4, v5) and extracts wallet-specific fields like seqno and public key. For other contracts, returns the raw state.

get.description: Returns wallet-specific information for an address. If the address is a known wallet contract, returns the wallet type, current seqno (needed for sending transactions), and wallet_id. Always check `wallet: true` before using wallet-specific fields. Call this before sending any transaction to get the current seqno.

post.description: Returns wallet-specific information for an address. If the address is a known wallet contract, returns the wallet type, current seqno (needed for sending transactions), and wallet_id. Always check `wallet: true` before using wallet-specific fields. Call this before sending any transaction to get the current seqno.

get.description: Returns just the TON balance of an account in nanotons. 1 TON = 1,000,000,000 nanotons. This is a lightweight alternative to getAddressInformation when you only need the balance. Returns "0" for addresses that don't exist yet.

post.description: Returns just the TON balance of an account in nanotons. 1 TON = 1,000,000,000 nanotons. This is a lightweight alternative to getAddressInformation when you only need the balance. Returns "0" for addresses that don't exist yet.

get.description: Returns the lifecycle state of an account. Possible values: `uninitialized` (address has no deployed contract but can receive TON), `active` (contract is deployed and working), `frozen` (contract suspended due to zero balance, send TON to unfreeze). Check this before interacting with a contract.

post.description: Returns the lifecycle state of an account. Possible values: `uninitialized` (address has no deployed contract but can receive TON), `active` (contract is deployed and working), `frozen` (contract suspended due to zero balance, send TON to unfreeze). Check this before interacting with a contract.

get.description: Returns metadata for Jetton or NFT contracts. Automatically detects the contract type and returns appropriate fields. For Jetton masters: total supply, admin, metadata. For Jetton wallets: balance, owner. For NFT items: collection, owner, content. For NFT collections: item count, metadata.

post.description: Returns metadata for Jetton or NFT contracts. Automatically detects the contract type and returns appropriate fields. For Jetton masters: total supply, admin, metadata. For Jetton wallets: balance, owner. For NFT items: collection, owner, content. For NFT collections: item count, metadata.

get.description: Returns the current state of the TON masterchain. The `last` field contains the latest block, which you'll need for querying current state. The seqno in `last` is the current block height. Call this first to get the latest block reference for other queries.

post.description: Returns the current state of the TON masterchain. The `last` field contains the latest block, which you'll need for querying current state. The seqno in `last` is the current block height. Call this first to get the latest block reference for other queries.

get.description: Returns validator signatures for a specific masterchain block. Each signature proves that a validator approved this block. Use this for building cryptographic proofs or verifying block authenticity in trustless applications.

post.description: Returns validator signatures for a specific masterchain block. Each signature proves that a validator approved this block. Use this for building cryptographic proofs or verifying block authenticity in trustless applications.

get.description: Returns a Merkle proof that links a shardchain block to a masterchain block. This proof cryptographically verifies that the shard block is part of the canonical chain. Essential for light clients and cross-chain bridges that need to verify shard data without trusting the API.

parameters.name: from_seqno
parameters.description: Seqno of masterchain block starting from which proof is required. If not specified latest masterchain block is used

post.description: Returns a Merkle proof that links a shardchain block to a masterchain block. This proof cryptographically verifies that the shard block is part of the canonical chain. Essential for light clients and cross-chain bridges that need to verify shard data without trusting the API.

get.description: Returns the latest block that has reached consensus. Unlike the latest block from getMasterchainInfo, this block is guaranteed to be final and will never be reverted. Use this when you need absolute certainty that a transaction is permanent.

post.description: Returns the latest block that has reached consensus. Unlike the latest block from getMasterchainInfo, this block is guaranteed to be final and will never be reverted. Use this when you need absolute certainty that a transaction is permanent.

get.description: Finds a block by position or time. Specify workchain and shard, then provide either: seqno (exact block number), lt (find block containing this logical time), or unixtime (find block closest to this timestamp). Returns the full block ID including hashes needed for verification.

post.description: Finds a block by position or time. Specify workchain and shard, then provide either: seqno (exact block number), lt (find block containing this logical time), or unixtime (find block closest to this timestamp). Returns the full block ID including hashes needed for verification.

get.description: Get shards information by given masterchain block seqno

post.description: Get shards information

get.description: Returns block metadata without the full transaction list. Includes timestamps, validator info, and references to previous blocks. Use this for block explorers or when you need block info but not the transactions inside.

post.description: Returns block metadata without the full transaction list. Includes timestamps, validator info, and references to previous blocks. Use this for block explorers or when you need block info but not the transactions inside.

get.description: Returns the current size of the outbound message queue for each shard. A growing queue indicates network congestion. If the queue is large, your transactions may take longer to process. Monitor this to detect network issues.

post.description: Returns the current size of the outbound message queue for each shard. A growing queue indicates network congestion. If the queue is large, your transactions may take longer to process. Monitor this to detect network issues.

get.description: Returns a summary of transactions in a specific block. Each item contains the account address and transaction ID, but not full transaction details. Use `count` to limit results and `after_lt`/`after_hash` for pagination. Call getTransactions with each transaction ID to get full details.

post.description: Returns a summary of transactions in a specific block. Each item contains the account address and transaction ID, but not full transaction details. Use `count` to limit results and `after_lt`/`after_hash` for pagination. Call getTransactions with each transaction ID to get full details.

get.description: Returns full transaction details for all transactions in a block. Unlike getBlockTransactions, this includes complete transaction data with messages, fees, and state changes. Useful for block explorers and indexers that need to process entire blocks.

post.description: Returns full transaction details for all transactions in a block. Unlike getBlockTransactions, this includes complete transaction data with messages, fees, and state changes. Useful for block explorers and indexers that need to process entire blocks.

get.description: Returns transaction history for an account. Transactions are returned newest-first. Each transaction shows the incoming message that triggered it, all outgoing messages, and fees paid. For pagination: use the `lt` and `hash` from the oldest transaction as the starting point for the next request.

post.description: Returns transaction history for an account. Transactions are returned newest-first. Each transaction shows the incoming message that triggered it, all outgoing messages, and fees paid. For pagination: use the `lt` and `hash` from the oldest transaction as the starting point for the next request.

get.description: Standardized version of getTransactions

post.description: Standardized version of getTransactions

get.description: Finds a transaction by message parameters. Given a source address, destination address, and message creation time (created_lt), returns the transaction that processed this message. Useful when you sent a message and need to find when it was executed.

post.description: Finds a transaction by message parameters. Given a source address, destination address, and message creation time (created_lt), returns the transaction that processed this message. Useful when you sent a message and need to find when it was executed.

get.description: Finds the transaction that received a specific message. Given message parameters, returns the transaction on the destination account that processed the incoming message. Use this to trace message delivery across accounts.

post.description: Finds the transaction that received a specific message. Given message parameters, returns the transaction on the destination account that processed the incoming message. Use this to trace message delivery across accounts.

get.description: Finds the transaction that sent a specific message. Given message parameters, returns the transaction on the source account that created this outgoing message. Use this to trace where a message originated from.

post.description: Finds the transaction that sent a specific message. Given message parameters, returns the transaction on the source account that created this outgoing message. Use this to trace where a message originated from.

get.description: Returns a specific blockchain configuration parameter. TON stores all network settings on-chain as numbered parameters. Common ones: 0 (config contract), 1 (elector), 15 (election timing), 17 (stake limits), 20-21 (gas prices), 34 (current validators). Check TON documentation for the full list.

post.description: Returns a specific blockchain configuration parameter. TON stores all network settings on-chain as numbered parameters. Common ones: 0 (config contract), 1 (elector), 15 (election timing), 17 (stake limits), 20-21 (gas prices), 34 (current validators). Check TON documentation for the full list.

get.description: Returns all blockchain configuration parameters at once. Includes gas prices, validator settings, workchain configs, and governance rules. Use the optional seqno to get historical configuration at a specific block height.

post.description: Returns all blockchain configuration parameters at once. Includes gas prices, validator settings, workchain configs, and governance rules. Use the optional seqno to get historical configuration at a specific block height.

get.description: Returns smart contract library code by hash. Some contracts reference shared libraries instead of including all code directly. When you encounter a library reference in contract code, use this endpoint to fetch the actual library implementation.

post.description: Returns smart contract library code by hash. Some contracts reference shared libraries instead of including all code directly. When you encounter a library reference in contract code, use this endpoint to fetch the actual library implementation.

Executes a read-only method on a smart contract. Get methods let you query contract state without sending a transaction. Common methods: `seqno` (wallet sequence number), `get_wallet_data` (wallet info), `get_jetton_data` (token info). Pass method arguments in the `stack` array.

Executes a get method with typed stack entries. Unlike runGetMethod which uses arrays, this endpoint uses explicit types (TvmStackEntryNumber, TvmStackEntryCell, etc.) for clearer input/output handling. Recommended for complex method calls.

Broadcasts a signed message to the TON network. The `boc` parameter must contain a complete, signed external message in base64 format. The API validates the message and forwards it to validators. Returns immediately after acceptance; use getTransactions to confirm the transaction was processed.

Broadcasts a signed message and returns its hash. Same as sendBoc, but also returns the message hash which you can use to track the message status. Use tryLocateTx with this hash to find when the message was processed.

Calculates the fees required to send a message. Provide the destination address and message body. For new contract deployments, also include init_code and init_data. Set ignore_chksig to true since you're estimating before signing. Returns a breakdown of storage, gas, and forwarding fees.

address.name: address
address.description: The account address to query. You can use any format: raw (0:abcd), base64 (EQ), or base64url (UQ). The API automatically detects and converts the format.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: A 256-bit hash in hex (64 chars) or base64 (44 chars) format. Used to identify blocks, transactions, and messages uniquely.

hashOptional.name: hash
hashOptional.description: A 256-bit hash in hex (64 chars) or base64 (44 chars) format. Used to identify blocks, transactions, and messages uniquely.

workchain.name: workchain
workchain.description: The workchain to query. Use -1 for masterchain (validators, system contracts, config) or 0 for basechain (regular accounts and contracts). Most user transactions happen on workchain 0.

shard.name: shard
shard.description: The shard identifier. Masterchain always uses -9223372036854775808. For basechain, shards split and merge dynamically. Use the `shards` endpoint to discover current shard configuration.

seqno.name: seqno
seqno.description: The block sequence number. Each shard numbers its blocks starting from 0. For masterchain, this is also called the block height. Higher numbers are more recent blocks.

seqnoOptional.name: seqno
seqnoOptional.description: Query state at a specific block height. If omitted, returns the current state. Use this to look up historical data at a specific point in time.

rootHashOptional.name: root_hash
rootHashOptional.description: The block's root hash for verification. Together with file_hash, this uniquely and cryptographically identifies a block. Only needed when you require proof of block identity.

fileHashOptional.name: file_hash
fileHashOptional.description: The block's file hash for verification. Together with root_hash, this provides cryptographic proof of block identity. Only needed for trustless verification.

afterLtOptional.name: after_lt
afterLtOptional.description: Pagination cursor. Pass the `lt` value from the last item in your previous response to get the next page. Transactions and messages are ordered by logical time.

afterAccountHashOptional.name: after_hash
afterAccountHashOptional.description: Secondary pagination cursor for block transactions. When multiple accounts have transactions at the same lt, use this to continue from a specific account.

countOptional.name: count
countOptional.description: Maximum number of items to return. The default is 40. Use smaller values for faster responses or larger values to reduce the number of API calls.

limitOptional.name: limit
limitOptional.description: Maximum number of transactions to return. The default is 10. For accounts with many transactions, use pagination (lt + hash) to fetch more.

ltOptional.name: lt
ltOptional.description: Starting point for transaction history. Pass the lt from `last_transaction_id` to start from the most recent, or from a specific transaction to continue pagination.

toLtOptional.name: to_lt
toLtOptional.description: Stop fetching when reaching this logical time. Use this to limit the time range of returned transactions. Set to 0 (default) to fetch all available history.

archivalOptional.name: archival
archivalOptional.description: Request data from archival nodes. Regular nodes only keep recent history (about 2 days). Set to true when querying old transactions or historical state. Archival requests may be slower.

sourceAddress.name: source
sourceAddress.description: The sender's address for the message you're looking for.

destinationAddress.name: destination
destinationAddress.description: The recipient's address for the message you're looking for.

createdLt.name: created_lt
createdLt.description: The logical time when the message was created. You can find this in the `created_lt` field of message objects.

EmptyRequest.description: Empty request body for endpoints that require no parameters.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

AddressRequest.description: Request containing a single address parameter.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.
Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

shard.description: Shard identifier. A signed 64-bit integer. Masterchain uses -9223372036854775808.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

from_seqno.description: Starting masterchain block for proof generation.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

shard.description: Shard identifier. A signed 64-bit integer. Masterchain uses -9223372036854775808.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

lt.description: Logical time of this event. A globally unique counter that orders all blockchain events. Higher values are more recent.

LookupBlockRequest.description: Request to find a block by workchain, shard, and either seqno, lt, or unixtime.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

shard.description: Shard identifier. A signed 64-bit integer. Masterchain uses -9223372036854775808.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

root_hash.description: Merkle root hash of the block state tree. Used for cryptographic verification.

file_hash.description: Hash of the serialized block data. Together with root_hash, uniquely identifies a block.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

shard.description: Shard identifier. A signed 64-bit integer. Masterchain uses -9223372036854775808.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

root_hash.description: Merkle root hash of the block state tree. Used for cryptographic verification.

file_hash.description: Hash of the serialized block data. Together with root_hash, uniquely identifies a block.

after_lt.description: Return items after this logical time (for pagination).

after_hash.description: Return items after this hash (for pagination within same lt).

count.description: Maximum number of items to return.

BlockTransactionsRequest.description: Request to fetch transactions from a specific block with optional pagination.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

lt.description: Logical time of this event. A globally unique counter that orders all blockchain events. Higher values are more recent.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

to_lt.description: Stop returning items at this logical time.

archival.description: Whether to use archival nodes for old data.

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return.

TransactionsRequest.description: Request to fetch transaction history for an account with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

source.description: Sender address. Empty string for external messages (sent from outside the blockchain).

created_lt.description: Logical time when this message was created. Use with source and destination to uniquely identify a message.

config_id.description: Configuration parameter number. Each number controls different blockchain settings.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.
Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

libraries.description: Array of library hashes to fetch.

boc.description: The message to broadcast, serialized as a BOC (Bag of Cells) and base64 encoded.

SendBocRequest.description: Request to broadcast a signed message. The boc field contains the base64-encoded external message.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

body.description: Message body in BOC format, base64 encoded.

init_code.description: Contract code for deployment, in BOC format.

init_data.description: Initial contract state for deployment, in BOC format.

ignore_chksig.description: Skip signature verification. Set to true when estimating fees before you have a real signature.

EstimateFeeRequest.description: Request to estimate transaction fees. Include the target address, message body, and optionally init code/data for contract deployment.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

method.description: The get method name (e.g., "seqno", "get_wallet_data") or its numeric ID.

JsonRpcRequest.description: A JSON-RPC 2.0 request. Set `method` to the API method name (e.g., "getWalletInformation") and `params` to a dictionary of parameters.

TonAddr.description: A TON account address. Accepts raw format (workchain:hex like 0:abc...), base64 bounceable (EQ...), base64 non-bounceable (UQ...), or base64url. All formats are automatically detected.

TonAddrWithoutWorkchain.description: The account ID portion of an address without the workchain prefix. This is the 256-bit identifier in hex or base64 format.

TonHash.description: A 256-bit hash value. Accepts either hex format (64 characters) or base64 format (44 characters). Used for block hashes, transaction hashes, and cryptographic proofs.

TonHashHex.description: A 256-bit hash in hexadecimal format. Exactly 64 characters (0-9, a-f).

Int256.description: A large integer represented as a string to avoid precision loss. Used for balances and other values that may exceed JavaScript's safe integer limit.

Bytes.description: Binary data encoded as base64. Used for serialized cells (BOC format), message bodies, and smart contract code/data.

account_address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

shard.description: Shard identifier. A signed 64-bit integer. Masterchain uses -9223372036854775808.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

root_hash.description: Merkle root hash of the block state tree. Used for cryptographic verification.

file_hash.description: Hash of the serialized block data. Together with root_hash, uniquely identifies a block.

TonBlockIdExt.description: A complete block identifier with cryptographic hashes. Contains workchain, shard, seqno (position) plus root_hash and file_hash (verification).

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

InternalTransactionId.description: A reference to a specific transaction. The combination of `lt` (logical time) and `hash` uniquely identifies any transaction. Use these values for pagination and lookups.

lt.description: Logical time of this event. A globally unique counter that orders all blockchain events. Higher values are more recent.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

code.description: Smart contract code in BOC format, base64 encoded.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

frozen_hash.description: Hash of the frozen contract state. Only present for frozen accounts.

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.
Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

seconds.description: Time period in seconds for this limit.

value.description: Amount of TON transferred in this message, in nanotons (1 TON = 10^9 nanotons).

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

unlocked_balance.description: Balance available for withdrawal in nanotons.

init_timeout.description: Timeout for channel initialization in seconds.

close_timeout.description: Timeout for channel closing in seconds.

signed_A.description: True if Alice signed the close.

signed_B.description: True if Bob signed the close.

state.description: Current state of the payment channel.

frozen_hash.description: Hash of the frozen contract state. Only present for frozen accounts.

workchain_id.description: Workchain identifier (0 for basechain, -1 for masterchain).

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

resolver.description: Address of the next DNS resolver.

wallet.description: True if this address is a recognized wallet contract type. If false, wallet-specific fields won't be available.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.
Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

contract_type.description: Type of token contract: jetton_master, jetton_wallet, nft_collection, or nft_item.

total_supply.description: Total number of tokens in existence, in the smallest unit. Divide by 10^decimals for human-readable amount.

mintable.description: Whether new tokens can still be created. If false, the total supply is permanently fixed.

admin_address.description: Address that can mint new tokens or change settings. May be empty if admin rights were revoked.

jetton_content.description: Token metadata: name, symbol, decimals, description, image URL.

jetton_wallet_code.description: Code used to deploy user wallets for this token. Used to verify wallet authenticity.

JettonMasterData.description: Jetton (fungible token) master contract data. Contains total supply, whether minting is allowed, admin address, and token metadata (name, symbol, decimals). This is the central contract that tracks the token.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

contract_type.description: Type of token contract: jetton_master, jetton_wallet, nft_collection, or nft_item.

balance.description: The account or token balance in the smallest unit (nanotons for TON, or base units for tokens). Divide by 10^decimals to get the human-readable amount.

owner.description: Current owner of this wallet or NFT.

jetton.description: Address of the Jetton master contract for this wallet.

mintless_is_claimed.description: True if mintless jettons were claimed.

jetton_wallet_code.description: Code used to deploy user wallets for this token. Used to verify wallet authenticity.

JettonWalletData.description: Jetton wallet contract data. Each user has a separate wallet contract for each token they hold. Contains the token balance, owner address, and reference to the master contract.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

contract_type.description: Type of token contract: jetton_master, jetton_wallet, nft_collection, or nft_item.

next_item_index.description: Index that will be assigned to the next minted item. Also indicates total items if minted sequentially.

owner_address.description: Current owner of this wallet, NFT, or collection.

collection_content.description: Collection metadata: name, description, cover image.

NftCollectionData.description: NFT collection contract data. Contains the number of items minted, collection owner, and collection metadata (name, description, image).

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

contract_type.description: Type of token contract: jetton_master, jetton_wallet, nft_collection, or nft_item.

index.description: This item's position in the collection.

collection_address.description: Address of the NFT collection this item belongs to.

owner_address.description: Current owner of this wallet, NFT, or collection.

NftItemData.description: Individual NFT data. Contains the item index, collection reference, current owner, and item-specific content/metadata.

TokenData.description: Token metadata returned by getTokenData. Can be a Jetton master, Jetton wallet, NFT collection, or NFT item depending on what contract you queried.

AccountStateEnum.description: The lifecycle state of an account: `uninitialized` (no contract deployed), `active` (contract working normally), or `frozen` (suspended due to zero balance).

node_id_short.description: Short identifier of the validator node.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

proof.description: Merkle proof for this shard block.

to_key_block.description: True if destination is a key block.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

account.description: The account address that this transaction belongs to.

lt.description: Logical time of this event. A globally unique counter that orders all blockchain events. Higher values are more recent.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

body.description: Message body in BOC format, base64 encoded.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

source.description: Sender address. Empty string for external messages (sent from outside the blockchain).

value.description: Amount of TON transferred in this message, in nanotons (1 TON = 10^9 nanotons).

extra_currencies.description: Non-TON currencies transferred. TON supports multiple native currencies.

fwd_fee.description: Fee for forwarding this message to its destination, in nanotons.

ihr_fee.description: Instant Hypercube Routing fee in nanotons. Usually 0 as IHR is rarely used.

created_lt.description: Logical time when this message was created. Use with source and destination to uniquely identify a message.

body_hash.description: Hash of the message body. Use this to verify message content without the full body.

msg_data.description: The message body containing instructions for the destination contract.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

utime.description: Unix timestamp (seconds since 1970-01-01). When this event occurred in real-world time.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

transaction_id.description: Reference to this transaction. Use `lt` and `hash` to fetch full details.

fee.description: Total fees paid for this transaction in nanotons.

storage_fee.description: Fees paid for storing the contract state on-chain, in nanotons. Charged based on contract size and time.

other_fee.description: Computation and action fees in nanotons. Covers gas for executing contract code.

in_msg.description: The incoming message that triggered this transaction. External messages come from outside the blockchain.

out_msgs.description: Messages sent by this transaction. A transaction can send multiple messages to different destinations.

account.description: The account address that this transaction belongs to.

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

source.description: Sender address. Empty string for external messages (sent from outside the blockchain).

value.description: Amount of TON transferred in this message, in nanotons (1 TON = 10^9 nanotons).

extra_currencies.description: Non-TON currencies transferred. TON supports multiple native currencies.

fwd_fee.description: Fee for forwarding this message to its destination, in nanotons.

ihr_fee.description: Instant Hypercube Routing fee in nanotons. Usually 0 as IHR is rarely used.

created_lt.description: Logical time when this message was created. Use with source and destination to uniquely identify a message.

body_hash.description: Hash of the message body. Use this to verify message content without the full body.

msg_data.description: The message body containing instructions for the destination contract.

message.description: Human-readable comment if the message body is a simple text comment.

message_decode_error.description: Error text if the message body couldn't be decoded as a comment.

Message.description: A message between accounts. Contains sender, recipient, TON amount transferred, and the message body. The `created_lt` field orders messages globally.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

account.description: The account address that this transaction belongs to.

utime.description: Unix timestamp (seconds since 1970-01-01). When this event occurred in real-world time.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

transaction_id.description: Reference to this transaction. Use `lt` and `hash` to fetch full details.

fee.description: Total fees paid for this transaction in nanotons.

storage_fee.description: Fees paid for storing the contract state on-chain, in nanotons. Charged based on contract size and time.

other_fee.description: Computation and action fees in nanotons. Covers gas for executing contract code.

in_msg.description: The incoming message that triggered this transaction. External messages come from outside the blockchain.

out_msgs.description: Messages sent by this transaction. A transaction can send multiple messages to different destinations.

Transaction.description: A single transaction on the TON blockchain. Contains the triggering message (`in_msg`), any messages sent (`out_msgs`), fees paid, and references for looking up related data.

ok.title: Ok
ok.description: Indicates if the request succeeded. If false, check the `error` field for details.

result.description: The response data. Only present when `ok` is true.

@extra.title: Extra information
@extra.description: Optional request ID that you can pass in the request and receive back in the response. Useful for matching async responses.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

TonlibErrorResponse.description: The `ok` field is always false, `code` contains the HTTP status, and `error` describes what went wrong.

ok.description: Always false for error responses.

code.description: HTTP status code. Common values: 404 (not found), 409 (conflict), 422 (validation error), 429 (rate limit), 500 (server error), 504 (timeout), 542 (liteserver error).

error.description: Error message explaining what went wrong.

@extra.description: Extra data passed through from the request.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.
Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

test_only.description: True if this is a testnet address.

balance.description: The account or token balance in the smallest unit (nanotons for TON, or base units for tokens). Divide by 10^decimals to get the human-readable amount.

extra_currencies.description: Non-TON currencies transferred. TON supports multiple native currencies.

last_transaction_id.description: Reference to the most recent transaction. Use as starting point for getTransactions.

block_id.description: Full block identifier where this event occurred.

code.description: Smart contract code in BOC format, base64 encoded.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

frozen_hash.description: Hash of the frozen contract state. Only present for frozen accounts.

sync_utime.description: Unix timestamp when this data was synced.

state.description: Account state: uninit, active, or frozen.

suspended.description: True if the account is suspended.

AddressInformation.description: Raw account state including balance, code, data, and status. The code and data fields contain the smart contract in BOC format.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

balance.description: The account or token balance in the smallest unit (nanotons for TON, or base units for tokens). Divide by 10^decimals to get the human-readable amount.

extra_currencies.description: Non-TON currencies transferred. TON supports multiple native currencies.

last_transaction_id.description: Reference to the most recent transaction. Use as starting point for getTransactions.

block_id.description: Full block identifier where this event occurred.

sync_utime.description: Unix timestamp when this data was synced.

account_state.description: Current lifecycle state: uninitialized, active, or frozen.

ExtendedAddressInformation.description: Account information with parsed wallet state. For wallet contracts, extracts wallet-specific fields instead of returning raw code/data.

wallet.description: True if this address is a recognized wallet contract type. If false, wallet-specific fields won't be available.

balance.description: The account or token balance in the smallest unit (nanotons for TON, or base units for tokens). Divide by 10^decimals to get the human-readable amount.

account_state.description: Current lifecycle state: uninitialized, active, or frozen.

last_transaction_id.description: Reference to the most recent transaction. Use as starting point for getTransactions.

wallet_type.description: The wallet contract version: v1r1 through v5r1. Newer versions (v4, v5) have more features.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

wallet_id.description: Subwallet ID for v3+ wallets. Allows creating multiple wallets from one key. Default is 698983191 for mainnet.

is_signature_allowed.description: For v5 wallets: whether external signatures are enabled. If false, wallet is controlled only by plugins.

WalletInformation.description: Information about a wallet account. The `wallet` field indicates if this is a known wallet type. If true, `wallet_type`, `seqno`, and `wallet_id` will be populated. Check seqno before sending transactions.

MasterchainInfo.description: Current masterchain state. The `last` block is the most recent, `init` is the genesis block. Use `last.seqno` as the current block height.

state_root_hash.description: Merkle root of the entire blockchain state at this block.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

ConsensusBlock.description: The latest block that has achieved finality. Unlike the tip of the chain, this block is guaranteed to never be reverted.

Shards.description: List of shardchain blocks at a specific masterchain height. Shows how the basechain is currently partitioned.

BlockHeader.description: Block metadata including creation time, validator info, and links to previous blocks. Does not include the transactions themselves.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

after_merge.description: True if block was created after a merge.

after_split.description: True if block was created after a split.

before_split.description: True if block was created before a split.

want_merge.description: Indicates if validators wanted a merge.

want_split.description: Indicates if validators wanted a split.

is_key_block.description: True if this block is a key block.

shards.description: List of outgoing message queue sizes per shard.

ext_msg_queue_size_limit.description: Limit for the external message queue size.

ConfigInfo.description: Blockchain configuration data. Contains one or more config parameters as requested. Each parameter controls different aspects of network operation.

result.description: The response data. Only present when `ok` is true.

LibraryResult.description: Library code fetched by hash. Contains the actual code cells for shared libraries referenced by smart contracts.

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

incomplete.description: Indicates if the transaction list is incomplete

id.description: Request ID. Pass any string and it will be echoed in the response.

incomplete.description: Indicates if the transaction list is incomplete

hash.description: Unique identifier hash for this object.

ExtMessageInfo.description: Information about a broadcast external message. Contains the message hash which you can use to track its processing.

ResultOk.description: Simple success response with no additional data.

storage_fee.description: Fees paid for storing the contract state on-chain, in nanotons. Charged based on contract size and time.

fwd_fee.description: Fee for forwarding this message to its destination, in nanotons.

QueryFees.description: Estimated fees for a transaction. Shows the breakdown between storage fees (for contract state), gas fees (for computation), and forward fees (for message delivery).

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

method.description: The get method name (e.g., "seqno", "get_wallet_data") or its numeric ID.

stack.description: Input arguments or output values as a TVM stack. Each entry has a type and value.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

gas_used.description: Amount of gas consumed during execution. Useful for estimating costs of similar operations.

stack.description: Input arguments or output values as a TVM stack. Each entry has a type and value.

exit_code.description: TVM execution result: 0 or 1 means success, other values indicate errors. Check TON docs for error codes.

RunGetMethodStdResult.description: Same as RunGetMethodResult but uses typed stack entries for clearer output parsing.

data.description: Raw transaction or contract data in BOC (Bag of Cells) format, base64 encoded.

special.description: True if this is a special cell.

address.description: The account address in user-friendly format.

method.description: The get method name (e.g., "seqno", "get_wallet_data") or its numeric ID.

stack.description: Input arguments or output values as a TVM stack. Each entry has a type and value.

seqno.description: Block or wallet sequence number. For blocks, this is the block height. For wallets, increment this for each outgoing transaction.

RunGetMethodRequest.description: Request to execute a smart contract get method. Specify address, method name/ID, and input stack.

gas_used.description: Amount of gas consumed during execution. Useful for estimating costs of similar operations.

stack.description: Input arguments or output values as a TVM stack. Each entry has a type and value.

exit_code.description: TVM execution result: 0 or 1 means success, other values indicate errors. Check TON docs for error codes.

block_id.description: Full block identifier where this event occurred.

last_transaction_id.description: Reference to the most recent transaction. Use as starting point for getTransactions.

RunGetMethodResult.description: Result of executing a smart contract get method. Contains the TVM exit code (0 or 1 means success), gas used, and the output stack with return values.

workchain.description: Workchain ID: -1 for masterchain, 0 for basechain. Most user transactions are on workchain 0.

testnet.description: Whether the address is for testnet.

result.description: The response data. Only present when `ok` is true.
